intro: Oberonioides purpureoviridis, commonly known as the purple-green moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, carpet-like growth habit and its distinctive dark green to purple-colored thallus. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are small and inconspicuous, emerging from the gametophyte stage. Oberonioides purpureoviridis plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its native habitats.
